name: Active Scanning
description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans to gather information that can be used during targeting. Active scans probe infrastructure via network traffic.

name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands.

name: Brute Force
description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts when passwords are unknown or password hashes are obtained.

name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

name: Data Encrypted for Impact
description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network to interrupt availability to system and network resources.

name: Application Layer Protocol
description: Adversaries may communicate using OSI application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering.

name: Network Service Scanning
description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts and local network infrastructure devices.

name: Network Denial of Service
description: Adversaries may perform Network Denial of Service (DoS) attacks to degrade or block the availability of targeted resources to users.

name: Valid Accounts
description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, or Privilege Escalation.

name: Remote Services
description: Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a service specifically designed to accept remote connections.

name: Server Software Component
description: Adversaries may abuse legitimate extensible development features of servers to establish persistent access to systems.

name: Impair Defenses
description: Adversaries may maliciously modify components of a victim environment in order to hinder or disable defensive mechanisms.

name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command-and-control channel.

name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon.

name: Process Injection
description: Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

name: Account Discovery
description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of accounts on a system or within an environment.

name: Exploitation for Client Execution
description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities in client applications to execute code.

name: Phishing
description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.

name: System Services
description: Adversaries may abuse system services or daemons to execute commands or programs.

name: System Information Discovery
description: An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware.
